Row.Text: Capital receives +2 boost to all yields. All cities receive +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing and -1 [ICON_Amenities] amenities. Government Centers receive +1 to all yields.
All cities with a district receive +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities. Government centers provide +1 Great Scientist, Artist and Writer points per turn.
+4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for land units. Government Centers provide +2 Great General Points and +30% unit production to their home city.
+2 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes. Government Centers provide +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route.
+2 [ICON_Housing] Housing in any city with Medieval Walls. Cities with a Government Center receive an additional heavy cavalry or anti-cavalry unit whenever they train one.
Can buy land units with faith. Units receive +5 [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength in theological combat. Government Centers receive +150% adjacency.
Patronage of great people costs 50% less gold. Cities with a government center receive +1 to all great person points.
Land units receive +4 [ICON_Strength] Defense Strength. Cities with a government center receive an additional +10% [ICON_Production] Production.
All combat units gain +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength. Cities with a Government Center receive an additional melee, ranged, heavy cavalry, or aircraft unit whenever they train one.
